alert.note: Alert for Josephine (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 6:06PM PDT until August 17 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Slater burn scar in... Northwestern Siskiyou County in northern California... South Central Josephine County in southwestern Oregon... * Until 900 PM PDT. * At 606 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Slater Burn Scar. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is possible in and around the Slater Burn Scar. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Slater Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Slater Burn Scar. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Slater Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
